result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S Spors was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, with the victim's children.  Contact with the victim at agent's discretion if the victim requests contact.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Attend and successfully complete domestic violence programming, if agent recommends.

timeConds.notes: Sentence to start on or before April 29, 2016 at 6:00 P.M.  If defendant violates any probation conditions prior to that, sentence to start immediately.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S Spors

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of case status change

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Victim notification complied with.  Plead guilty to amended count 1, class A. misd battery, domestic. 940.19(1).  968.075(1)(a).   DRI count 2. Granted.   Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he is pleading to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of the amended Count 1.  Count 2 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 18 mo.  probation.  No contact with the victim's children.  Contact with the victim at agent's discretion.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA, and recommendations.  DV programming.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 18 months probation.  No contact with the victim's children.  Contact with the victim at agent's discretion if the victim requests.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  AODA, and recommended treatment.  DV programming, if agent recommends.  The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  $200.00 fine, plus CC, DNA surcharge and sample.  20 days jail.  Start by 4/29/16 at 6 pm.  Violate any rule of probation, sentence to start immediately.

Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing.
sent to Judge electronically.  JMM

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.    AMENDED 2/22/16.   Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses: with the minor children of R.S.  No contact condition with R.S. lifted.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-04-2016 01:30 pm

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Victim notification complied with.  Victim is present.  Defendant to plead to amended count 1, misd. Battery, as domestic abuse.   Count 2, to be dismissed,  but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 12 months probation.  Court questionning amending the charge to a misdemeanor.  Reschedule plea/sentencing when ADA Inlow is here.  4/4/16 at 1:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-22-2016 01:30 pm

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Fredrickson.  Plea/sentencing to be set.  Defense requesting no contact condition of bond be lifted.  State has not talked to the victim.  Court did not order a change as State has not talked to the vicitm.

Pre-trial conference at 12-30-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 01-25-2016 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived the time limit for holding the preliminary hearing.
